newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-POLL SETS SECOND WORLD RECORD.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-POLL SETS SECOND WORLD RECORD.

text.p: Costa Rica's Claudia Poll set her second world record in 24 hours when she eclipsed a 10-year-old mark for the women's 400 metres freestyle at the world short-course swimming championships on Saturday.
Poll, who shattered her own 200 freestyle record on Friday, hurtled through the 16 lengths of the 25-metre Scandinavium arena pool in four minutes 0.03 seconds.

The performance comprehensively beat the 4:02.05 posted by East German Astrid Strauss in Bonn on February 8, 1987, and completed a golden double for Poll, who also won the 200 and 400 freestyle at the last world short-course championships in 1995.
Poll took charge before the 100-metre mark and stretched way ahead of her rivals, going through the halfway mark already two seconds inside world record pace.
Australia's Natasha Bowron, winner of Friday's 800 freestyle, had set the fastest time in the morning heats but never got close to the Costa Rican, settling for the silver in 4:05.76.
Germany's Kerstin Kielgass, silver medallist behind Bowron in the 800, took the bronze in 4:07.13.
